intro: Cosmos jaliscensis, commonly known as the Mexican coffee bean plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens. Cosmos jaliscensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
